analysis.title: 36 (ANIMALS)
analysis.author: Richard Price
analysis.logline: A disgraced NYPD detective seeks revenge after his wife's death, unraveling a complex web of police corruption that destroyed his life and career.

concept.justification: Compelling exploration of police corruption spanning decades, with a protagonist driven by personal tragedy and systemic injustice

structure.justification: Masterful non-linear narrative, intricate plot progression, perfectly calibrated act breaks, and sustained narrative tension

protagonist.justification: Frank Bruno is a complex, morally nuanced protagonist with clear motivations, agency, and a devastating character arc

supporting_cast.justification: Rich, multi-dimensional characters like Dennis Kline, Eddie Benitez, and Danny provide depth and narrative complexity

dialogue.justification: Richard Price's signature naturalistic dialogue, laden with subtext, authentic police vernacular, and emotional depth

genre_execution.justification: Exceptional handling of crime drama conventions, subverting expectations while delivering genre satisfactions

originality.justification: Fresh take on police corruption narrative, innovative structural approach, deeply personal perspective

cast_attachability.note: Multiple compelling roles for prestige actors

marketing_hook.note: Dramatic revenge narrative with systemic corruption angle

budget_return_ratio.note: Moderate budget required, strong festival/critical potential

comparable_success.note: Similar to critically acclaimed crime dramas

structure_analysis.act_breaks: Initial incident in 1985, midpoint at Eddie's death, climax at Kline confrontation

supporting: Eddie Benitez - Loyal partner with tragic arc
Lola Bruno - Daughter representing hope and continuity

assessment.recommendation_rationale: Exceptional screenplay demonstrating extraordinary craft, with a weighted score of 8.75, zero critical failures, and a commercial viability score of 17/18. Represents a singular voice in crime drama storytelling.

film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Absolutely. This screenplay represents the pinnacle of character-driven crime storytelling.
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: Extremely high. A nuanced exploration of institutional corruption and personal redemption

analysis.verdict_statement: FILM NOW: 36 (ANIMALS) represents exceptional material that demands immediate greenlight consideration. The Lightning: A generational crime drama revealing systemic police corruption through personal tragedy. The Craft: Weighted score of 8.75 with no dimension below 8. The Commercial Case: CVS of 17/18. Joaquin Phoenix or Ryan Gosling as Frank Bruno presents extraordinary star potential. Urgency: This screenplay will not remain available.
